name: A Shot in the Dark (Bard 5 / AA 9 / Assassin 26)
author: neo.dietrich

posts.author: neo.dietrich
posts.content:
Just picked up NWN:EE and have been working on a character build for a while. I think I've got the class and stat spreads worked out, but I could use some help with class timing and feat selection. The basic concept is a reliable archer that uses Darkness to rack up Death Attacks.

So here's the bare-bones:

Elf, NE/CE, 1-40
S- 14
D- 16
C- 8
W- 8
I- 16
Ch- 14

Bard 1-5
Assassin 6-10
AA 11-19
Assassin 20-40

It seemed fairly straightforward, but of course, that made me feel a little odd. (What's ever straightforward?) AB and AC seem decent enough. Lots of skills to work with. As far as feats go, they also seem pretty easy. All your basic archery feats (PBS, Rapid Shot, WF, Called Shot, etc.) fit right in. Epic feats are also pretty basic. Great Dex and Imp. Sneak Attacks, as well as Epic Prowess and EWF. Can even get a Blinding Speed in there. No self concealment, though, because it doesn't get Improved Evasion.

I guess my biggest questions would be whether the class spread seems right, when to take feats (epic in particular) and whether it even seems viable.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Thorsson wrote: Spellcraft 7?
7 + a bonus of 3 from intelligence is 10.
At lvl 5 the best you can get is 8.
If you cap intelligence you can have 6 more. So your spellcraft target is 15 with buffs.
It will be easier to achieve with 8 base ranks. But once you can have Intelligence 26 from items or buffs, you are OK with 7 ranks.
If you know that you can cap intelligence, 6 ranks will get the job done.

posts.author: neo.dietrich
posts.content:
So I played through the OC, SOU and HOTU with Mick's build. It's good. It's fun. But the entire time, I was just wondering what I could get out of it that I couldn't get from a Rogue/Wiz/AA. And in the end, it just doesn't compare.

If you want to play a Bard/AA/Assasin, Mick's build is what you want. It's not a bad build at all. But there are much better builds that do the same thing.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Rogue/Wizard/AA and Bard/AA/Assassin do have much in common. And you can build them very similar if you want.
For me, in the first combo, I give AA priority for high AB and consistant damage. Wizard serves as a stepping stone for AA with access to scrolls and mage items as a bonus. I only take a couple of levels of Wizard. Rogue is there for the skillpoints and skills and Uncanny dodge - and Epic dodge. I typically take 13 levels and SA is a nice bonus. Trap skills are core as secondary attack.
The assassin build goes much higher on assassin levels for an effective ranged Death attack. AA is primarily there to give EA V to pierce premonition and add some AB and a little extra damage. Bard is there because you need a base class in the build, and Bard is the only class that qualifies for both prestige classes within a reasonable number of levels.
I play that build as a stalker, and attack at close range.
The way I build and play, I end up with two very different characters and play styles.
Last week I finished playing the assassin build to lvl 40. I tested different play styles. It was very effective when I could pull single creatures from groups with a single long range arrow, before nailing them with a close range Death attack from stealth.
